Matt,

We will definitely release in the first quarter of 2006. We missed our
release date of January 1 because we encountered a new architectural
challenge when David wrote the Eclipse UI for JUnit 4 tests. We are still
sorting that out. Our current design is available from CVS on SourceForge,
although we hope to simplify it before release. 

I use the new release whenever I can. I think the tests read better than
they did in previous releases.

Sincerely yours,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

> Subject: [junit] ETA?
> 
> Apologies, I fully expect a good telling off for asking this but I 
> just can't find any clues...
> 
> We're currently developing a new test strategy and implementation for 
> our products and it seems that Junit 4 is quite close but not here 
> fully yet.  
> 
>  o What's the rough ETA (Q1, Q2 etc)? 
>  o Is the current Junit 4 worth using anyway?
> 
> Thanks in advance!
> 
> Regards
> Matthew Peddlesden
> Head of Product Development, ValidSoft Ltd.
